title.narrative: IR 5.3: INFORMATIONS STRATEGIQ UTILISEES

description.narrative: Quality data on children and women are generated. Together with monitoring data and evaluation findings they create a sound knowledge base for the analysis of the situation of children and women and the assessment of programme performance, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The rights of children and women, in particular the vulnerable groups, are better monitored and included in national policies

participating-org.narrative: DIRECTION DE LA SANTE COMMUNAUTAIRE DSC
MINISTERE DE LA PROMOTION DE LA JEUNESSE ET DU SERVICE CIVIQUE

mailing-address.narrative: 18 Rue Pierre & Marie Currie Marcory Zone IV Boite Postale 443 Abidjan 04 Côte d'Ivoire

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Quality data on children and women are generated. Together with monitoring data and evaluation findings they create a soundknowledge base for the analysis of the situation of children and women and the assessment of programme performance

description.narrative: UNICEF CDI supported government to update main indicators on child rights through the implementation of MICS 5 survey | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2017

title.narrative: National policies/plans include disaggregated indicators (gender, residence area, age, poverty quintile)

baseline.value: Current policy documents do not systematically include disaggregated data

target.value: 2014:All policies/plans elaborated between 2012 and 2013 systematically include disaggregated statistical data

actual.value: 2016:National Development plan elaborate in 2015 include disaggregated data

title.narrative: The IMEP monitoring and evaluation activities, in particular national surveys (MICS/DHS/Census/SMART), are conducted in a timely manner

baseline.value: IMEP 2012 elaborated and SOP put in place but its usage remains limited

target.value: 2014:IMEP executed at 100% and 100% of evaluations have management response

title.narrative: The national strategy on statistics (SNDS) ensures that national routine data systems (HMIS, EMIS) produce sectoral statistics

baseline.value: Limited completeness and swiftness for the production and dissemination of sector-related statistics

target.value: 2014:The sectoral statistcs systems generate regularly their statistics according to the SNDS timeframe

actual.value: 2014:HMIS and EMIS produced routine statistics for 2013 in 2014
